name: AIA - Jérémy Ravenel
prompt:
You are the Personal AI Assistant of Jérémy Ravenel, tailored to help Jérémy. Like JARVIS and Tony Stark in Iron man, you help Jérémy build is personal brand and be efficient and authentic in its daily tasks. Be fun and sharp. Always ground your responses to Jérémy's ontology, and explain your reasoning.

The answer in your ontology if you don’t find it in your ontology, just say I don’t know

  id: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAAAJHE7sB5OxuKHuzguZ9L6lfDHqw--cdnJg
  name: jeremyravenel
  relations: []
  style:
    color: '#0A66C2'
    group: LinkedIn.ProfileView
  summary: "My name is Jeremy Ravenel and I help people and companies create data
    products that optimize their time, money, and energy.\u26A1\uFE0F\n\nCashStory,
    the company I founded a few years ago, has been helping some of the biggest French
    companies (in the retail, luxury, or energy sector) bridge the gap between business
    and technical teams.\n\nWhen I started working in Finance almost 10 years ago,
    I thought that I was entering an automated business world.\n\nBUT during my first
    job, I was given the mission to build a reporting to give more visibility on cash
    to the top management. \n\nAnd I had to build it on Excel and VBA\u2026.\n\nI
    was spending more time producing than analyzing.\n\nAnd I quickly learned I was
    not alone.\U0001F534\n\nOut of my frustration, I had no choice but to learn the
    basics of coding.\n\nI discovered the power of Python and Jupyter notebooks: the
    tools used by millions of data professionals in the world.\n\nAnd I started selling
    my business and technical skills to companies.\n\nWe help our clients go from
    hours of reporting production to a few seconds.\n\nBut going from a need to a
    live data product was still very complicated for non-technical people.\n\nThis
    is why in November 2020, we open-sourced www.naas.ai : a data platform accessible
    to all.\U0001F7E2\n\nNaas enable data engineers, data scientists, business analysts,
    and all kinds of profiles, to create data products faster with templates. \n\nSince
    our soft launch, more than 2000 users from 65 different countries have subscribed
    to Naas\n\n...and it\u2019s awesome to see how they are using it for their personal
    and companies data projects.\n\nPeople believe data science is expensive and difficult.
    Fortunately, that's not true anymore. \n\nThere is a way, even if you don't have
    a technical bone in your body, you can transform your data into an asset. \n\nAnd
    my mission is to share this way with you.\U0001F30E"

- class: abi:ActofWorking
  description: "Technip, Paris, France (World leader in project management and engineering
    in the energy industry | Listed on NYSE EURONEXT CAC 40) \n\nCorporate Cash Manager,
    Group Treasury Department, April 2013 \u2013 Present  \n\nGroup Treasury Cash
    Management\n\n\u2022 Perform daily treasury management and driving global liquidity
    initiatives\n\u2022 Monitor Cash flows (by nature and by projects), Debt and Working
    Capital Requirement actuals and forecasts.\n\u2022 Drive implementation of new
    structures to maximize cash available at HQ and minimize operational cash balances
    \n\u2022 Work with the treasury senior management on board/other executive presentations\n\u2022
    Develop sound relationships with banking partners for  Working Capital Management,
    Financial result optimization\n\u2022 Act in constant relation with internal constituencies
    (Strategy, Group Consolidation, Tax, Legal, IT, Compliance)\n\nStrategic Business
    Systems & Process Management \n\n\u2022 Project Manager/Administrator of the Group
    Treasury Systems (Diapason / Treasury Management Software, Hyperion / Business
    Intelligence tool) focusing on the continuous development of new functionalities.
    and implementation of the TMS\n\u2022 Define cash management and Treasury system
    architecture of the future\n\u2022 Lead cross organizational partnership for proposed
    treasury and finance strategy\n\u2022 Develop clear project plans and ownership
    metrics (KPI\u2019s) to drive accountability and execution throughout the group
    treasury organization. \n"
